node.title: CST_Storage_11
node.doctext:
CST review archive 11

This is a storage node for CST reviews. Contents are moved her from [CST_Chat].

This archive begins on 3/26/04, When it's full we'll move to [CST_Storage_12].

See also Quest Storage collabs [CST_Storage_1|1], [CST_Storage_2|2], [CST_Storage_3|3], [CST_Storage_4|4], [CST_Storage_5|5], [CST_Storage_6|6], [CST_Storage_7|7], [CST_Storage_8|8], [CST_Storage_9|9], [CST_Storage_10|10], [CST_Storage_11|11].

26 March 2004 Batch processed by gom

Writeup Title:[Melody of you]
Author:[dannye]
Reviewer: [GrouchyOldMan]
Public domain?: N
Original Author's Permission received?: N
Quoted content less than 33%: YES
Compliance Assessment: Yes per fair use
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes: 2004.3.17 Dannye says [Melody of you]. -- wordcount? I'm trying real hard to remove all offenders.
Tc = 1100, Tq = 191, %q= 17%

Writeup Title:[I get a kick out of you]
Author:[dannye]
Reviewer: [GrouchyOldMan]
Public domain?: N
Original Author's Permission received?: N
Quoted content less than 33%: NO
Compliance Assessment: NO N
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes: 2004.3.17 Dannye says [I get a kick out of you]. Old Enough?
Apparently Cole Porter's original publication, from [Anything Goes] was 1934, so, even though these lyrics appear to be published all over the web, our policy would be to rely on Fair Use. According to my word count, you need to add another 245 words to comply. I'd hope you can see your way clear to do that because I like the song. Also, champaigne -> champagne, Tc = 244, Tq = 163, %q= 66%
[dannye] says Thanks for your help. I added the tag to all approved w/u's. And I removed "[I get a kick out of you]".

This writeup is not compliant with the E2 FAQ: Copyrighted Material . It needs more original content." AS OF 3/4/04 STILL WAITING FOR A RESPONSE...NUKING ON 3-22

04/04/04 Batch processed by gom

Writeup Title:[Dunce cap]
Author:[SkiBum5]
Reviewer: [Lometa]
Public domain?: No.
Original Author's Permission received?: No.
Quoted content less than 33%: 100%
Compliance Assessment: No.
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes: 2004.3.31@1:20 [Lord Brawl] says [Dunce cap] seems to be attributed (at the end) to some one who is not the noder.
Hello [SkiBum5], Unfortunately because of the [E2 copyright changes] E2 can no longer keep material in the database without meeting fair use or getting the author’s permission. If you would like to resubmit the write up you may want to read through [E2 FAQ: Copyrighted Material]. If you have any questions please feel free to ask.

Writeup Title:[The Lonely 1]
Author:[69lovesongs]
Reviewer: [Lometa]
Public domain?: No.
Original Author's Permission received?: Permission has been requested
Quoted content less than 33%: 14%
Compliance Assessment: Yes.
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes: 2004.4.4@0:51 [69lovesongs] says Hi there, my writeup [The Lonely 1] contains a lyric quote. Could you please give it a review for compliance? Thanks a lot. :)
2004.4.4@0:53 [69lovesongs] says re: [The Lonely 1] I forgot to mention that I've sent an email to Wilco requesting permission and that it's on my scratchpad. Thanks.
Hello [69lovesongs], [The Lonely 1] has been reviewed by the [CST_Group] and is compliant. Please append this hardlink [CST Approved] . It’s a great write up! For better voting mileage you might want to add the date the song was released and maybe a small three four line bio blurb about the band.

Compliance Assessment: No
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes: 2004.4.2 (2.5 hr) dannye says some last questions by Jurph?
Hi there, Bad news I'm afraid. This writeup doesn't appear to be compliant with the [E2 FAQ: Copyrighted Material|E2 copyright policy]. If you're interested in updating it for compliance I'll be glad to assist, otherwise I'll remove it next [04/09/04|Friday].
[Jurph] says re: some last questions - You're right. I don't think I'll be able to make it compliant, so I'll clear it out myself. Thanks.
Tc = 224, Tq = 128, %q= 57%

[All Fall Down] was released by [Against All Authority] in February 2001. Fled users write up deleted.
Hello FumA , I’m sorry to say that because of the [E2 copyright changes] E2 can no longer keep lyrics unless they meet fair use. If you would care to resubmit your wrote up you may want to refer to [E2 FAQ: Copyrighted Material] for some guidelines.

Writeup Title:[Every Day's a Holiday When You're Pagan: February]
Author:[Nymph- o]
Reviewer: [Lometa]
Public domain?: Y
Original Author's Permission received?: N/A
Quoted content less than 33%: Y
Compliance Assessment: Yes.
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes:2004.03.26 at 10:39 [GrouchyOldMan] says Review Request: [dannye] says There are a couple (at least) like this: [Every Day's a Holiday When You're Pagan: February]. Are they OK? In fact, I think a lot of Nymph-o's work might need looked at. Like [Shake, Rattle and Roll].
All of the user’s comments are original content and lists are not copyrightable unless there is a substantial amount of factual or creative writing.

Writeup Title:[Shake, Rattle and Roll]
Author:[Nymph- o]
Reviewer: [Lometa]
Public domain?: No.
Original Author's Permission received?: No.
Quoted content less than 33%: 77%
Compliance Assessment: No.
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes:2004.03.26 at 10:39 [GrouchyOldMan] says Review Request: [dannye] says There are a couple (at least) like this: [Every Day's a Holiday When You're Pagan: February]. Are they OK? In fact, I think a lot of Nymph-o's work might need looked at. Like [Shake, Rattle and Roll].
Hello [Nymph- o], I’m sorry to say that because of the [E2 copyright changes] E2 can no longer keep lyrics on the web site unless they meet the criteria of fair use. It you would care to resubmit the write you may want to refer to [E2 FAQ: Copyrighted Material] for some guidelines. Please feel free to message me if you have any questions.
There has been a request made to audit [Nymph- o]’s account for copyright compliance. Because of a potential conflict of interest I am going to bow out. There are only 26 write-ups not including the several day logs. Is there someone else would care to take on this task?

Reviewer: [Lometa]

Hello Mr. Hotel, I’m sorry to say that the quoted content in [A Positive LSD Story] is 99% exceeding the 33% required to meet fair use. If you would care to resubmit it please read through the [E2 FAQ: Copyrighted Material]. If you have any questions please feel free to ask.

Writeup Title:[Carnival of the Animals]
Author:[no_one]
Reviewer: [Lometa]
Public domain?: Yes
Original Author's Permission received?: N/A
Quoted content less than 33%: N/A
Compliance Assessment: Yes!
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes:2004.03.25 at 04:41 [no_one] says yo wassup. [Carnival of the Animals] quotes poetry; compliance review requested! Many thanks eternal gratitude &c&c
Piano fanfare! Strings, regally marching! Piano accents! Bass! Xylophone! Up the keyboard, down the keyboard! ROOAAR! Wonderful write up! [Carnival of the Animals] has been reviewed by the [CST_Group] and is compliant. Please append this hardlink [CST Approved] . Thank you.

Hello SansPoint, This write up was submitted for a [CST Review]. It’s copyright compliant! Please append this hardlink [CST Approved] if you would like to:) You may want to run this through a spell checker because there are a number of typos. It could be the source of the down votes.

Writeup Title:[Brazil]
Author:[dreznik]
Reviewer: [Lometa]
Public domain?: N/A
Original Author's Permission received?: N/A
Quoted content less than 33%: Y
Compliance Assessment: Y
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes: 2004.03.23 at 18:45 [Ouroboros] say I would like to request a review of the whole node [Brazil] for copyright issues, particularly lyrics from the theme song to the movie (why are movie theme songs even considered remotely important? for the most part they are cobbed together by marketing departments to show off an "artist" whose contract is held by the recordings division of the distribution company carrying the film, they are just another marquee name thrown onto the wood pile to make up for the fact that John Williams is busy conducting the Boston Pops and we all know that he was ripping off Howard Hanson anyway {did I digress?}) and quotations. I should hope that quotations not of the dialogue, but of graffiti from the set be able to remain, as such backgrounded/supporting material rarely is recorded and given proper treatment in other mediums for synopsis and review.
Commentary about the country Original content is 100%.

Hello bol, I’m sorry to say that the words quoted from your copyrighted source (http://www.trond.com/brazil/faq.html) is 63% of your write up and exceeds 33% to meet fair use. If you would like to update to meet compliance please let me know and I’ll review it again, otherwise I'll remove it next [April 3, 2004|Saturday].
The quoted words are 63% of the write up and exceed 33% to meet fair use. You may want to read through [E2 FAQ: Copyrighted Material] if you would like to resubmit the write up. Please feel free to message me with any questions.

Writeup Title:[Down to the river to pray]
Author:[ive_brussel ]
Reviewer: [Lometa]
Public domain?: No.
Original Author's Permission received?: No.
Quoted content less than 33%: No.
Compliance Assessment: No.
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes: 2004.03.22 at 20:49 [ive_brussel] says Please review my writeups [Down to the river to pray] and [Shower your love]
Hello ive_brussel, I’m sorry to say that the lyrics for this song are under copyright and have to be removed from E2. If you would care to resubmit them please read how to under the [E2 FAQ: Copyrighted Material]. If you have any questions please feel free to msg me.

Writeup Title:[Shower your love]
Author:[ive_brussel ]
Reviewer: [Lometa]
Public domain?: No.
Original Author's Permission received?: No.
Quoted content less than 33%: 7.3%
Compliance Assessment:Yes.
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes: 2004.03.22 at 20:49 [ive_brussel] says Please review my writeups [Down to the river to pray] and [Shower your love]
[Shower your love] is very good. “A true unknown idol” is an excellent phrase to sum up the sentiment. You might want to run it through a spell checker, because there are a number of typos. It has been reviewed by the [CST_Group] and is compliant. Please append this hardlink [CST Approved] . Thank you.

Reviewer: [Lometa]

Compliance Assessment: Yes.
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes: 2004.03.22 at 00:50 [Valrus] says Sorry, I went ahead and noded my music writeup; it's now under [Pluto]. Thanks!
Nice commentary.

Writeup Title:[Cotton-eyed Joe]
Author:[messor]
Reviewer: [Lometa]
Public domain?: Yes.
Original Author's Permission received?: N/A
Quoted content less than 33%: N/A
Compliance Assessment: Yes.
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes: 2004.03.21 at 17:48 [messor] says Could you check my write-up on [Cotton-Eye Joe]? I figure that if it's minstrel-era American music it's safe, but you never know.
This song was field-collected prior to 1925, but no recording was made of this version.( http://www.luckymojo.com/bluescottoneyedjoeunknown.html) so it’s in public domain. This could use more hard links. There’s a lot of info out there about this song. You might want to do a google search and add some explication and that it’s a fairly popular dancing song for square dancing rounds as well as polkas. Tis compliant! Please append this hardlink [CST Approved] . Thank you.

Writeup Title:[Every Day's a Holiday When You're Pagan: January]
Author:[Nymph- o]

Writeup Title:[The Lord's Prayer: Pidgin English]
Author:[mauler]
Reviewer: [GrouchyOldMan]
Public domain?: N
Original Author's Permission received?: N
Quoted content less than 33%: Y
Compliance Assessment: Y
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes: GrouchyOldMan says re The Lord's Prayer: Pidgin English: Did you write the Tok Pisin, Kamtok, etc. translations, or are they from the other sources you cited?
mauler says I wrote all the descriptions myself. The Hawaiian and Gullah prayers are quoted directly from the sources cited (I don't have personal knowledge of these languages). I have some familiarity with the other two languages, so the Tok Pisin and Kamtok prayers were written by me, but I used the cited sources as a guide/to check. I pretty followed the Kamtok source pretty closely, but I made some changes to the Tok Pisin sources, adding some words that are more modern in usage. The Tok Pisin translation is wholely my own. I would be surprised if this writeup doesn't fall under some reasonable definition of fair use. No single quotation takes up more than a small fraction of the total writeup, and these aren't exactly song lyrics - they're the Lord's prayer. The reason people translate this in the first place is that they want "The word of God" to be disseminated as widely as possible.
Okay, this is completely compliant under fair use and we'd be proud to have you add the [CST Approved] tag if you wish. If you are interested in the CST_Group review, I've posted it on my scratchpad. Very nice work!
Tc = 839, Tq1 = 160, Tq2 = 89, Tq3 = 73, Tq4 = 919, %q1= 19%, %q2= 11%, %q3= 9%, %q4= 11%
